result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin

1:59 PM Defendant Adam J Lumina in court.  Attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin.  DE has completed obligations requested by the State.   Court wants DE to go to 3 AA meetings a week.  Court will grant a 30 day setover. 
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

8:52 AM Defendant Adam J Lumina in court.  Attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of right to atty signed.  Set for 2nd STC in 30, de needs to provide documentation and then case will be dismissed.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards John L. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

09:38 AM Defendant appeared.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
